column1: #text=I needed to write a school report on tigers , and I decided to visit the library to find a book to use in my research .
#text=When I entered the library , I saw hundreds of books on many different shelves and was not sure where to find books on tigers .
#text=I asked a librarian for help finding books on tigers .
#text=Are you looking for stories about tigers , or facts and photographs about tigers ?
#text=I told her I wanted facts and real information so I can write a report .
#text=She walked over to a group of shelves labeled Nonfiction and told me that these books all had true facts and pictures , rather than being imaginary stories .
#text=They are put in a special order using number codes called the Dewey Decimal System .
#text=Using these codes , all the books on tigers would be in the same place and would be very close to books about other animals .
#text=She looked up the Dewey Decimal System code for tigers and wrote it down for me .
#text=Walking through the shelves with my code , I saw that the numbers on the spines of the books start at zero and keep getting bigger and bigger .
#text=Finally , I was getting close to the number she wrote down for me .
#text=There I saw books about lions , cheetahs , and finally tigers .
#text=I found a book that looked like it would be helpful for my report and brought it back to the librarian .
#text=She asked me for my library card , and after I handed it to her , she scanned it with her computer .
#text=Next , she scanned a barcode on the back of the book .
#text=Now the book was checked out in my name so that the library would know who has the book .
#text=She handed me the book and told me that I needed to bring it back to the library in two weeks .
#text=If I did n't bring it back , I would have to pay a fine for every day I kept it , because other people might want to read the book too .
#text=I thanked her and went home to work on my report .
